intro: Ranunculus truncatus, commonly known as the bluntleaf buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and western Asia. It features showy, yellow flowers with five to eight petals, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually trifoliate or palmately lobed, with a rough, hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. The species is characterized by its distinctive, truncate (notched) leaf base and its ability to spread through rhizomes.
